radiographic_examinations.findings: In the right lower quadrant, the appendix is hyperemic, fluid-filled and dilated measuring up to 11 mm in diameter with periappendiceal fluid and inflammation. No free air is identified. An adjacent reactive lymph node is noted. The liver contains a hypodensity in the left lobe measuring 6 mm, most likely a simple cyst or ciliated foregut cyst. The right adrenal gland contains a 2.5 x 1.5 x 2.7 cm lesion, incompletely characterized. No concerning osseous lesion is seen. Small amount of pelvic free fluid noted.
